description.narrative: By 2014, 90% of parent-teachers in the seven post conflict prefectures are able to provide a minimum standard of quality education., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, 50% of enrolled girls and boys successfully complete quality primary education.

description.narrative: In 2017, the MoE provided training for 1,601 parent X teachers (25%) of the parent-teacher pool) on basic pedagogical skills in order to ensure that children acquire basic skills (reading, writing and maths) with support from UNICEF and IPs. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:17/01/2018
